column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have lived with migraines for 18 years and have gone through so many different treatments before my doctor switched me to Botox injections every 3 months and Relpax for when I get a migraine. Both are miracle's to me. I was having about 28 migraines a month with recurring to no relief at all. Now I only get about 5 a month and I take the Relpax and it is gone within an hour or so. The only down side is that I get 9 a month and have to pay 13 dollars for them.

column2: headacheallday, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After 3 nerve release surgery, I started being treated for the new picture of my illness. The first try was treating with Relpax. Extremely expensive, impossible to be approved by my insurance for the correct number of tablets a week...First week - I was supposed to take a max of 4 a week - it helped a bit...3rd week, my headache - which is milder after the surgeries - were back, not as intense, not as steady, but back.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: cold sweat, nausea

column2: Jingle, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: First time using it - got rid of the headache within minutes - which I LOVED but the side effects are really making think I don't want to take it again.  I got the tightness in the chest and jaw and I just feel completely drained.  Maybe it will get better since it was my first time taking it. I rarely have any of the side effects noted so this was a first for me.  Would have given it 5 stars all around if it weren't for that weird feeling I got.  I would give it 100 stars just for getting rid of the pain :-)

column2: ellen, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: This is a wonder drug.  Same pain relief as with immitrex but fewer side effects.

column2: Charlie, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I really want to share the benefits of Replax with each and every migraine sufferer.I have had severe and debilitating migraine since birth, the kind where I would lose my vision become paralized from the wait down, I would be vomiting and screaming in pain. I have tried every migraine drug that has become available over the past 40 years with no relief. I really didn't think I wanted to live like this any longer as the pain had taken control of my life. I could barely make it too work most days and I could never plan to do anything, I lived my life in fear of the next attack which was always only just around the next corner. I started seeing a new GP and I broke down to him and said I just can't do this anymore and he asked me if I had tried Replax? I said no, but I'm willing to try anything, not having much hope as I have been so excited about new treatments many times and then really disappointed when they all didn't work. So I started on 40 mg, the next migraine I took my 40mg Replax and it really was helping but with an hour the migraine had broken through.So I took another Replax and it helped but once again the migrain broke through.So now I am on the 80mg tabs and Replax has completey changed my life. I thank my doctor everytime I see him and tell him how he is truly responsible for me now having a pain free life. I can say yes to friends and make plans to do things, I can work and not have to feel so embarassed of all the time I had to take off. Please if you are a migraine sufferer of any degree, you must try this treatment.I have had no side effects, I just have my life back.x

column2: jgbach6685, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: It was like a tiny magic pill, got rid of my migraine within 10 minutes, my vision came back, the light and noise sensitivity went away, i didn't feel the nausea anymore and i wasn't in any pain or dizziness. However, it did give me fast heart rate and that was quite uncomfortable. i'm on the lowest dose. I was, i am pregnant, so i can't take it until after i'm delivered. but i will gladly take fast heart rate over vision corrupting migraine!

column2: dlavin, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I am required to use my Relpax 40mg onset of a migraine, and not to take another one for 2 hours. Well at 1pill 40mg does not work on mine, I have to take the 2nd pill 20min to 1/2 hour later if my head can stand it. well sometimes that does not work and I can only take 2 pills in a 24 hour period. So I end up taking my Fioricet if the 2nd Relpax does not touch my migraine,then the pain in my head starts to go away....I know you have to be careful because taking Fioricet to much can set off cluster migraines..but to be honest with you....I get my migraines 15 days out of a month and last bad one i had lasted 8 days in a row...

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: this drug is expensive, but really works!  I don't even have a migraine  "hangover" after its gone.

column2: cwestpain, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: After many years exploring medications my Neurosurgeon prescribed this as well as the Fiorcet w/out codeine and Depakote, as I have tumors in my head.  I am a Contractor and cannot take mind altering medications and the Relpax worked for me the first time and has NEVER let me down yet. So many years of trying medicines that made me all strung out and then we tried this and it was like the story of the Three Little Bears-it was just right!  My insurance won't cover it and I can only get 9 tablets per month at $308, but I only use it in an emergency.  I did the IV w/Demerol and Morphine in the old days and that was so bad.  I'd have to stay overnight at the Hospital and all.  I just wish they would make medications that were not so expensive or at least make the insurance companies cover them.

column2: kellyp, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have tried every medicine out there over the years - nothing (short of intravenous demoral) has helped me like Relpax. It's a bit more expensive and my insurance keeps trying to get me to switch to Imitrex (which doesn't work for my migraines) but I refuse to switch.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was previously on Maxalt, which didn't always work for me, when my Doc prescribed the Relpax.  It works well for me within a half hour of taking it.  The only downside is the price.

column2: lyn2love, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: My migraines are so severe i could commit suidide. They are extremely expensive even with insurance, they should make them more affordable. They are relpax.

column2: kellysue, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I am disabled by my frequent and all the other stuff that comes with the package. If I feel a migraine coming, I take my relpax, a couple of tylenol 3's, and a phenergan. So far after 20 years of searching, trying most of the triptans, Relpax is head and shoulders above the rest. The only thing I'm worried about is I am living on very limited income and my insurance will only let me have 6 more pills. My Doc wants to put me on Maxalt. I tried it and it barely touched my migraines. Luckily, I did some research and found that Maxalt is contrindicated when taking propranolol.(which I have been taking for years for migraines). The only reason I'm not 100% satisfied is because I am afraid I won't be able to control these migraines from hell- This is the FIRST TIME I'm not heading to the ER screaming in pain, wondering if they think I'm a drug seeker.

column2: Active Middle Age Mom, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I've tried many of the meds in the "triptan" family" and have found nothing to be as effective as Relpax. Approx. 90% of the time, Relpax is very effective at getting rid of my migraine headhache.  The majority of the time, I only have to take 1 pill w/very little, if any, side effects.   The other 10%, I immediately start vomitting w/my headache so I can't keep any meds down for prevention.  My migraines started in college, tappered off when I had childred in late 20's - early 30's, and then returned in my late 30's.  I see a Neurologist regularly and am now taking Topimate 100mg night, Relpax and will use a steriod pack if we can't break a migraine cycle that lasts for more than 24 - 36 hours.  Not sure why my migraines are increaseing in frequency and pain as I get older but it's not fun to live with for me or my family!

column2: Lifeback, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have daily migraines that no doctor can seem to diagnose why except that it is "thought" to be premenopausal. After trying about 50 different medications, and several different type of Dr's my Neurologist prescribed Relpax. It is amazing! Yes, I do get a little tired sometimes but I have my life back. I've been taking Relpax daily for about 6 months now. I know only 3 per month have been tested but I would be in bed daily with no life if it weren't for this miracle drug. Pfizer needs to study daily use to let consumers know of any long term damage. If I wait and take it when I have a headache it takes about 2 hours to kick in so I take it at the first sign. It makes me feel happy (I believe it's because I have a life) and takes away "all pain" such as neck/back/muscle pain. Relpax doesn't work for everyone but for me, it's my life. My insurance tries to limit to 6 per month but Dr's request can override that. When I began taking Relpax, I would have a heaviness in my chest but my body must have adjusted to it because now I have only slight tiredness. I can deal with being tired by drinking caffeine. Relpax is truly a miracle drug!

column2: Lena, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I get migraines 4 times a week. Relpax has been the best medication for me.  I have tried Imitrex and others nothing has worked as well as Relpax 40mg. The downside is at times I feel very weak and my body feels heavy, there are other days I take it and I am fine. I try to take it at night before bedtime if I feel one is coming and it worksgreat.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I suffer from migraines for 10+ years now. I've tried imitrex, that doesn't work as fast and the side effects after are flu like. Relpax relieves headache within 1 hour of taking and rarely do i need 2 pills to get rid the headache. the downside is the cost, but if you nee to come back from a rebound headache, tylenol 3 with codine is great1

column2: kae, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: this is the only medicine i have taken for migraine headaches.  this drug eases the pain and takes care of the other symptoms of a migraine.  migraines wake me in the middle of the night and i sometimes vomit the drug.  I wish there was another way to administer it other than oral

column9: Took it with breakfast about 7AM.  About 9:30, was so tired I went back to bed and slept for 5 hours.  Stayed up about 3 hours, and went back to bed again for 4 hours.  Up again about 7PM, but drowsy and weak.  I'll stick with Imitrex or Vicodin and Xanax.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)

When I take it first I am very pleased with the results and my day is not ruined by pain.  The only side effects that I sometimes get are sleepiness and sometimes a little bit jittery.

column2: m21, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I ended up in the hospital with severe rectal bleeding that ended up being an ischemic colitis, most probably caused by the 2nd dose of Relpax. Extremely scary experience. I will suffer with the migraine if this is the only thing that will help my migraines...

column2: Jadejewels1983, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I find if I take this as soon as symptoms begin it works very well.  I sometimes require a second dose. I sometimes have difficulty with nausea/vomiting if the headache is full blown before I awaken to take the meds and then can't keep it down.  Does anyone have a suggestion for what to eat with it, cause nothing seems to work if I get to that point which happens somewhat often?

I do not like them at all.

column2: Always Read Frirst, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this med since I did not like the side effects of imatrex, 20 years. To get over being exhausted try caffeine.

column2: Jamie, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: This medication has changed my life.  I suffered with migraines that lasted 3 days and tried many of the other migraine medications with no relief.  I really thought I was doomed to live with them forever.  Relpax works within 45 minutes of taking and relieves ALL symptoms.  I use to be laid out for days praying for the moment when relief would start to come.  I missed time with my family, work and social commitments.  Now 1 pill and I can continue with my day virtually uninterrupted.  I can't imagine my life without it.  The only downside is the cost, but it is truly worth every penny.  If you have never tried this medication and are suffering with migraines, I urge you to try it.

column2: yogaguru, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: So far Relpax is the best drug for taking care of my migraines.  I do have to make sure I take it right at the start of my migraine or it isn't as effective, but usually it takes care of the headache and the other side effects (like nausea) that go along with the headache.  It doesn't give me the unwanted side effects like Treximet does also (dizziness, fatigue, nausea).  I am also worried about rebound headaches, because over the years the amount of pills I need a month has increased, but I have always been on more than one type (being careful not to mix them) because my insurance only lets me have 4 to 6 pills a month.  I used to need about 7 a month (combined), but now I need around 14 a month.  I'm not sure if it is the Relpax that is causing that or the Treximet (the other drug I take--which I'm trying to find a substitute for that doesn't have the side effects) or both or some other reason.  I have an appointment with an endocrinologist to see if hormone therapy might help decrease the amount of migraines I get a month because the main cause of my headaches has to do with my menstrual cycle.  We'll see.

column2: drj, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have suffered from migraines for over 30 years and this is the first drug that has helped - as long as I take it soon enough.  Insurance is a pain if I happen to need more than six pills a month.

column2: Ashley A., 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: This is my miracle working medicine!! I usually get at least one headache/migraine per week. This is the first medication I have been able to take that relieves my headache within a short timeframe and allows me to function throughout the rest of my day. I have see comments about the cost...If you think these are expensive, I used to use a different drug(Imitrex)and I paid more money for less pills, on top of that the medicine made me nauseous/sick and I couldn't function on it. Relpax is worth the money for the job it does. I am very pleased!!

column9: Suffering from Chronic Migraines, this medicine is the wonder drug! Relief is great and then you can function.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

Will have to consult with doctors on alternative...will probably go back to acupuncture which seemed to help as well.

column2: Steph, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have found this drug to be very effective, even if I don't manage to catch the migraine immediately.

column2: CH, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Relpax for 6 years now and is the only medication that has taken my headaches away completely in less than 1 hours. I feel 100% better and able to funtion completely the rest of the day. My issue is getting a doctor to prescribe it. They all tell me I am having "rebound" headaches from the mediation itself. Since I have had headaches now for 30 YEARS... I would say rebound is not exactly correct. My insurance does pay for 12 per month but that is the limit. My doctors seem to think that I should not be taking more than 1 or 2 a month. Obviously they do not suffer from migraines! Migraines have been a battle for my entire adult life and if Relpax is the only relief I can depend on why can I not have it "as needed". Give me a product that is safe to take as needed! PLEASE!

column2: Kelly, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking/prescribed Relpax since March 2007.  Just like all of you who have found it to be a wonder drug for your migraines; beware, DO NOT TAKE TOO MUCH!  I have been adding more and more tablets because I have had more and more migraines.I now have the migraines everyday which are caused by increasing the Relpax on a regular basis.  Now I am in Detox to rid my body of the Relpax.  I do not wish this upon anyone.  Seek expert advice.

column2: PainBgone, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: So far, Relpax has been the only drug to actually deliver results that I am stunned by. I was getting severe migraines about 1-2 times a month that were bad enough to send me to the emergency room. And I am not one to just go to the hospital on a whim.. The pain injections I would receive would knock me out within 15 minutes and I would be out until the next day. My neurologist prescribed Nortriptyline @ 50 mg for my reoccurring "regular" headaches and gave me Relpax for the migraines. Well, the Nortriptyline has really worked well on the everyday headaches and I'll pop a Relpax when I have a migraine, which has decreased to about one every 2-3 months, and within an hour it is gone. My only regret is that I waited almost 20 years before seeing a neurologist about my headaches. (I am still waiting for a check from all the OTC pain reliever companies for my single-handily keeping them rolling in the cash from all the massive amounts of pills I was taking)Yes, Relpax is on the expensive side, but it is worth every penny..

column2: 35-44 on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have five children and one grandchild. i don't have time to be down with a migraine. Relpax is my miracle drug. my 3-4 migraines a week are now controlled. thank god

column2: jenniferg753, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months

If I take this medicine when I first feel the migraine coming on, I am completely rid of the headache within 30 minutes.  Very rarely do I ever have to take two tablets. I do not experience any side effects except being tired for that day - but that's so much better than a migraine that I really don't mind being tired!!

column2: help4myhead, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This med. really works to combat my migraine although it seems to come back about 12 hours later.  It's the best med. yet for treating my headache.  My side effects, however, were severe drowsiness, constant yawning and nausea.  Has anyone else experienced depression with this drug?

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: i take one as soon as i sense one coming on. within thirty minutes i can ususally feel it working. rest is a must w/ me when i take the pill. works everytime and fast!

column2: cmg, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have always had problems with migraines here and there when I was younger, but then I starting having migraines that lasted about 3 days during my period. NOTHING got rid of it. I had tried hormone pills, Maxalt, Imitrex, Topamax, Verapamil, Loratab (after trying OTC drugs first of course) Sometimes it would get so bad I would have to go get a shot of Toredol & it was affecting my job. But after taking the Relpax it has been great! The headache is usually gone in about 1 hour. The only problems that I have is that before the headache goes away it feels like a band tightening around my head and it feels like the headache is getting worse, but then ALL of the pain is gone. I can function at work when I take it, but if I take it and get still then it does make me tired. All in all, it has been GREAT!

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: This treatment has been a life saver for me

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This is a relatively new med on the market and i have to say it works wonders.  for years I have been hopping around migraine meds and this by far works the best for me.  Although i will say i occasinally have the "chest pressure" they talk about.  Give it a try .. you'll be greatly surprised!

column2: Lauren, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been getting migraines for over 10 years now and usually get 1-2 migraines a week on top of cluster headaches.  My nuerologist introduced me to replax 4 years ago and it has been one of the most helpful drugs I have ever taken.  I also find taking 2 advils with the replax also helps.  I am also on daily preventative medicine.  This medicine is expensive and you are only allowed a certain amount per month so I do have to pick and choose which migraine is worth the medicine.  I do have a back up prescription for something else but it doesn't work as good.  Replax is a life saver and I couldn't live without it.  Before I used to go to the hospital for pain shots.  This drug does make me very tired and my chest tender from taking it but I can deal with that over the intense pain of a migraine.

column2: kbeuoy, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I suffer from cluster headaches that only happen once in a few years. This is the first medication I have taken that actually eases the symptoms. I have to take a 40mg pill every 12 hours or so but it actually works. The only other medication that had any effect is Imitrex, but it did not last long enough to really help. Oxygen is my primary cure for the pain. It's taken at around 7-10 liters per min but usually relieves the pain within 15 minutes.

column2: Cherries74, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Relpax is the most effective migraine med I've used, the only set back I receive is I am very tired the rest of the day, my heart rate increases sometimes and mostly every time I feel the tightness in my chest & neck.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: my previous migraine med no longer worked after years of use, Relpax works great.  The only change I'd like to see is for it to come in a sublingual tab with an easy open package.  When I wake up in the middle of the night with a migraine, the last thing I can do is struggle to get into it's little packet and then get up for some water.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: This medication works wonders. It's important to take at the start of symptoms, otherwise the migraine can return.  Only downside is severe prolonged drowsiness and some nausea.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I love this drug! Within an hour my pain is gone and I am back to normal!

column2: kwhitesav, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Relpax is a miracle drug! I have chronic daily migraines with related neck pain.  I can take this and withinn the hour, I am feeling much better.  Thanks!

column2: aparries, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I had unexplained migraines for a year and a half before I started with a new physician who prescribed Relpax to me. On rare occasions, my migraine is so bad I have to use 2 pills, but that's usually if I don't take it at the onset. Since I started taking Relpax, I rarely even have migraines. So it's not something I have to take every day. I usually only have to take one pill every few months. I haven't had any side effects, and I am so pleased. I couldn't thank my physician more.

column2: classictech, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: so far the only thing that works

It made me a little tired when I took it, and it actually didn't work very well. I'm thinking that I didn't take it at the very onset of the migraine.Also, too expensive. The box only gives you 6 pills.

column2: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Took it as my doctor prescribed, however I'm generally sensitive to medications. I started to feel tingly and had trouble breathing and swallowing. I also had some heart and chest palpitations. Despite the excess of side effects, I could tell the medicine helped the migraine, at least a little bit. Too bad the side effects were unbearable. Looks like I'll have to try a new one.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: works very well, however,there have been rare instances where it will not work. other than that, it's great. (expensive though!)

column2: DollyHark, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: This has been the only prescription that has worked has worked for me. I have dealt with mograines for years and other medications tend to make me feel worse. I can take it at any point during a headache and the pain is releived within an hour.

column2: specialkel, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Migraines are usually gone within one hour of taken Relpax if taken at onset of headache.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: It works quick and is easy to use!!Thank YOU

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I suffer from migraines (and on a daily med to prevent) and this is the only thing I have ever tried that gets rid of a migraine!  In rare instances, I have had to take 2 in a day and that was probably less than a handful of times.  Honestly, this medicine has probably given me back quality of life.

column2: salena1973, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had migraines for 25 years and this is the first drug I have ever taken that will make your headache go away. It doesn't require you to sleep it off. There is no headache hangover the next day. The only problem I have with this medicine is you are only allowed 6 pills for a month and they cost $160.00

column2: ksmith716, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
Debbie, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: You name it, I've tried it.  I have suffered with migraines since I was 14.  I am now 37 and for the first time in my life, I have found a drug that actually gets rid of my migraines without completely knocking me out.  The only drawback is that it makes me so relaxed that if I get still, I will fall asleep.  I liken the feeling of being on Relpax to having your eyes dilated.  You don't feel "drugged" like so many of the other migraine medications, but it does make you feel "wierd" like having your eyes dilated.  However, that is a small price to pay for getting rid of a migraine.  I am still able to function at work while taking the medication.

column2: Cherell72, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have tried so many different medications including imitrex. And Relpax is the best for my migraines. I only take one at the first sign of pain,and thats all i needed and I'm usually in pain for 3days,but not now I'm fine with Relpax.
I have had a lot of problems with Imitrex making me feel sick.  So far, I haven't experienced that with Relpax.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: for the most part I only need to take one tablet for my migraine to be gone.

column2: mjp119, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years
column9: I use this medication almost everytime I get a migraine. It usually relieves the symptoms within 1 hour or so, depending on how fast I took it after the onset.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: since starting this medicine everything i eat taste like salt.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Just started using this drug.  Imitrex was not working.

column2: itsgaby, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: i really love this med!! its small, its effective.. and your migrane is gone in less than an hour..at least for me it works great!
